Is Christ's Father the God of Abraham or is He someone different? 
 
 John8 
 [42] Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me: for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
 [43] Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.
 [44] Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

Pontius Pilate was a normal Roman for the times. Sure he was no peace-loving hippie but then neither was he a psychopath killing hundreds if not thousands.
 
 All the main Gospels make it clear Pilate did not think Jesus was guilty of anything. There have been many dubious translations of the Gospels.
 
 What is known is that under the normal political arrangements Pilate rules in conjunction with the local authorities; both sides were happy to keep the peace on their terms and at a highly volatile time such as the Passover would be double vigilant. Don't forget there was a considerable resistance movement going then by the Jews against the Romans. Hence the diaspora a few years later.
 
 Never forget also that what is a major action in our eyes was only a minor incident in the eyes of authority then. Jesus was presented as a rabble-rouser by the Jewish authorities. Pilate couldn't find any guilt in Jesus but hey lets keep a lid on things, execute him and peace will prevail.

 There is no suggestion that he was anything like a psychopath. Indeed if the rumours are correct, he became a christian himself.

AH, you are refering to a letter that is known to be a 3rd century fake.
 
 And it isn't just the references in Philo. There are the multiple references in Josephus that showed he was a tyrant, and brutal.

 
 Josephus was hardly unbiased, nor did he have any persoanl knowledge of what went on. It was only what he heard from what someone else had heard etc.
 
 Remember an old saying 'Believe nothing of what you hear and only half of what you see'. First told to me by an Army Sergeant.
 
 Josephus had a serious Jewish bias with an agenda for doing down Roman officials. There is considerable evidence (when you unearth the facts from the rumours) that Pilate was pretty even-handed and had a considerable empathy for the jewish customs once he had learnt the ropes and understood their ways.
 
 There is little or no reliable evidence to show that he was a bloodthirsty tyrant and psychopath. More that he was your average Roman official carrying on normal Roman policy.
 
 If he thought Jesus was so dangerous how come all the apostles were left alone, a decent burial was granted Jesus and no retribution fell on anyone ? If Pilate really thought there was a problem and if he was really the psychopath you are claiming then one would have expected violent action. There was none.

 Well, I don't accept the gospels as a source for historical information. I will just point out that both Josephus and Philo disagreed. Other than that, and the gospels, we have no information about Pilate. He did get removed for cruxifiying tons of pilgrams though.. That doesn't seem to match the gospels at all.

'Fraid not he did not crucify tons of pilgrims. He had a run in with what was thought to be an infiltration of freedom fighters using a procession as cover using his local troops armed with cudgels. A big fight broke out and some in the procession were killed but hardly a massacre.
